name: unvoiced
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not spoken or expressed, although thought of or felt: He takes a long time to realize that his unvoiced fears are groundless.
phonetics
  specialized (of a speech sound) produced without making the vocal cords move: The voiced plosives [b], [d], and [g] are produced in the same way as their unvoiced counterparts [p], [t], and [k]; the only difference is the voicing. Synonym
voicelessOpposite
voiced
More examplesFewer examplesHis body language suggested a man at ease with himself, although a few unvoiced uncertainties seemed to hang in the air.This is a study of patients' unvoiced agendas in general practice medical consultations.Possessive s is pronounced/z/ after a vowel or voiced consonant, /s/ after an unvoiced consonant.This -s in "goes to" is followed by an unvoiced sound.
